source: give it the benefit of the doubt
definitions: To believe someone's statement or to accept that something is good, even if you are not sure it is true or good.
To assume someone is innocent or telling the truth until proven otherwise.
To decide to believe someone or something, even though you have reasons why you might not.
examples: I'm not sure if his excuse is true, but I'll give it the benefit of the doubt.
The new restaurant had mixed reviews, but we decided to give it the benefit of the doubt.
She seemed a bit suspicious, but I chose to give her the benefit of the doubt.
lemma: give it the benefit of the doubt
